name: 20-Minute Thai Ginger Chicken Recipe (Gai Pad King)
description: This Thai ginger chicken recipe is a quick and easy gai pad king stir-fry that comes together in less than 20 minutes.
recipeIngredient: 7 ounces chicken (thinly sliced, breast or thighs)
1/2 cup green onions (chopped into 1-inch sized pieces)

recipeInstructions.text: Place a pan on medium-high heat and add oil. Stir-fry the minced garlic and sliced chilies in the pan until they become fragrant, about 20 seconds.
recipeInstructions.name: Place a pan on medium-high heat and add oil. Stir-fry the minced garlic and sliced chilies in the pan until they become fragrant, about 20 seconds.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the chicken slices to the pan. Continue to stir-fry until the chicken is fully cooked.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the chicken slices to the pan. Continue to stir-fry until the chicken is fully cooked.

recipeInstructions.text: Add white sugar, soybean paste, golden mountain sauce, oyster sauce, and white pepper into the pan. Ensure each piece of chicken is well-coated with the stir-fry sauce.
recipeInstructions.name: Add white sugar, soybean paste, golden mountain sauce, oyster sauce, and white pepper into the pan. Ensure each piece of chicken is well-coated with the stir-fry sauce.

recipeInstructions.text: Finally, add the ginger, mushrooms, and green onions to the pan. Toss everything together to mix well. Serve hot and enjoy!
recipeInstructions.name: Finally, add the ginger, mushrooms, and green onions to the pan. Toss everything together to mix well. Serve hot and enjoy!

keywords: ginger stir fry, Thai ginger chicken
